sub_title: Segment Architect at Shell IT International
summary:
Current role: IT Segment Architect in the Asset Management space. Shell Asset Management Company manages the pension funds for several Shell companies in The Netherlands, Canada, the US, the UK, etc. As Architect involved in defining the IT strategic roadmap for the years to come, but also involved in shorter term activities that support the long-term aspiration of SAMCo. Working on vendor selections for new software solutions that improve ways of working. Maintaining the roadmap and strategy in BiZZdesign. TOGAF 9.2 certified. 

Worked as Project Manager and Programme Manager on projects that make an immediate business impact. 
Specialties: unique 35 years of IT experience in Application Support in an international business environment. Knows the business processes on Finance, MI, (Group) Reporting, Financial Close and more specific to Shell, the IT environments for Gas & Oil resources accounting and reporting. Involved in external and internal IT and Business audits and the remediation of the findings and definition of (SOx) Controls. Experienced in working with Agile DevOps teams and acts as interim Scrum Master if and when needed. 

Worked with many applications and tooling like SAP, BPC, BW and SQL, but has also hands on experience with managing hardware, disaster recovery, software deployments, IT controls, etc. 

Jan has recent working experience in managing teams up to 30 staff in multiple globally spread 
locations. He is also experienced in working with third party suppliers, managed service contracts and outsourcing. He is also interested in areas next to oil and gas, like health care and education. 
Giving the nature of his work, Jan is able (and likes) to work with several levels in the organization. Daily stress and operational issues are handed well, but he is certainly also good in setting the long(er) term goals and have this discussed and agreed on senior levels.
